title: Wondering if this computer could play LoL?
body:
Hey just wondering if this PC would be good for a smooth experience on LoL with a good 50-60 Framerate solid how does this look
HP Compaq Presario CQ3420AN Desktop AMD Athlon ll X2 220 2.8Ghz 4GB RAM With 128GB SSD Windows 7
If you could reply asap would be greatful, Thanks

replies.body:
if this is what you're looking at: https://pctraders.co.nz/collections/computer-systems/products/hp-compaq-presario-cq3420an-desktop-amd-athlon-ii-x2-220-2-8ghz-4gb-ram-500gb-hdd-windows-7

It only uses integrated graphics, so honestly I think you'd struggle with the new client. 
It can certainly run league, but not very well. Maybe medium/low graphics and the client in "low spec mode".

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements

Look at these numbers and try to get closer to the "recommended" than the "minimum".

To run league well you are looking at a machine that will cost closer to 600-700.

Also after a quick browse on pctraders, if you are looking there i'd look elsewhere, they seem like a big rip off at those prices.
Hey man would you know of a good laptop to run lol for around 300-400 if you could have a quick look for me would be helpful ,add me on lol if needed

It would depend on your graphics card and what graphics setting you play on. Personally, my graphics card is HDD, and I can run medium-high on 60 fps. 

For integrated graphics, it should run at 60 fps on low, and perhaps medium provided you have a good processor (which it seems you do). 

If you have a good graphics card, then 60 fps on high should be easy. 

I had a laptop with a 1 GHz processor, worst graphics, really old, couldn't use a web browser because it was too much strain, and *MS Word* caused it to overheat and turn off, and even then I could play LoL (granted I had 15 fps with 500 ping on low-spec, the loading and victory/defeat screens would last forever, and patch updates would take 2 hours).

Thanks for that. Does this PC here not have a graphics card? And would you know of any other desktops or laptops that can run lol smoothly for around 300-400 dollars nz I would really appreciate it don't know much about req for computers to play lol
